concept.name: Person demographics
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This section contains the person’s
demographic and contact details including
key identifiers e.g. name, date of birth, NHS
number, address etc.
The PDS (Personal Demographics Service)
should be used as the source of this
information.
This section is mandatory. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The person's details and contact information.

concept.name: Person name
concept.description: Details of the person's name

concept.name: Person first name
concept.description: The first name(s) of the person. This includes middle names.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Person given name

concept.name: Person family name
concept.description: The family name or surname of the person
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Person family name

concept.name: Person preferred name
concept.description: The name by which a person wishes to be addressed. The preferred name volunteered by the person or a preferred name given by PDS that the person has asked to be called by.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Person full name

concept.name: Title
concept.description: Person's title
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Person title

concept.name: Person name suffix
concept.description: A textual suffix that may be added to the end of a PERSON's name, for example, OBE, MBE, BSc, JP, GM
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Person suffix

concept.name: Person full name
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This data item entry is mandatory.
Due to the possibility of transposition errors
and different person’s sharing the same
name, person name alone is not usually a
sufficient identifier <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The full name of the person in text representation.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Patient full name

concept.name: Date of birth
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This data item entry is mandatory.
Due to the possibility of transposition errors
and different person’s sharing the same date
of birth, this element alone is not usually a
sufficient identifier. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The date of birth of the person.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary:- Person birth date

concept.name: Gender
concept.implamentationGuidance:
Sex is not contained in the standalone
version of the Local Authority Information
(for shared health and care records
standards). However, local implementors
deciding to add the sex data item from the
core information standard to their local
record should note the following:
Sex and gender data items may cause
accidental disclosure of gender
reassignment without consent. This is
because both fields are included in the
demographic model. Having both may show
a difference and therefore disclose gender
reassignment without consent. It is unlawful
to disclose, without consent, a person’s
gender reassignment with or without a
gender reassignment certificate.
(ISB-000362 - ISB Standards Guidance –
Sex, Gender and Transgender - Data
Capture (2016))
This risk can be mitigated by appropriate
implementation in a shared care record;
refer to the Digital Social Care Information
clinical safety case report and hazard log for
more information. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The person's stated gender.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Person stated gender code

concept.name: NHS number
concept.implamentationGuidance:
NHS number (or equivalent, e.g. CHI
number in Scotland), is a national indicator
for matching records across health and
social care and is likely to be the primary
identifier however existing national guidance
should be followed, including how to handle
patients without an NHS number, for
example, overseas visitors.
It is recognised that local authorities face
issues in tracing, validating, storing and
holding the NHS number. However, the use
of NHS number or equivalent is a legal
requirement for local authorities unless they
are unable to reasonably comply – The
Health and Social Care (Safety and Quality
Act) 2015 <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The unique identifier for a person within the NHS in England and Wales.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary:- NHS number

concept.name: Other identifier
concept.implamentationGuidance:
The use of NHS number or equivalent
identifier is a legal requirement for local
authorities unless they are unable to
reasonably comply – The Health and Social
Care (Safety and Quality Act) 2015.
Existing national guidance should be
followed, including how to handle
patients without an NHS number or
equivalent, for example, overseas
visitors. NB: If the person does not have an NHS
number or equivalent the local authority may choose not to share local identifiers
deemed not relevant for sharing to the
record. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Country specific or local identifier, e.g. Community Health Index (CHI) in Scotland.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Local patient identifier(extended), Health and care number (NI only), Community health index number (Scotland only)

concept.name: Person's address
concept.implamentationGuidance:
The person’s correct address can be a
potential source of error. Include the
person’s current place of residence as the
primary address. <br clear="none"/> 
                     <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Person’s usual place of residence, and where relevant temporary and correspondence addresses.

concept.name: Address line 1
concept.description: Person's first line of address.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :-  Address line 1

concept.name: Address line 2
concept.description: Person's second line of address.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Address line 2

concept.name: Address line 3
concept.description: Person's third line of address.

concept.name: Address line 4
concept.description: Person's fourth line of address.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Address line 4

concept.name: Address line 5
concept.description: Person's fifth line of address.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Address line 5

concept.name: Postcode
concept.description: The person's postcode.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Postcode of usual address

concept.name: Date of death
concept.implamentationGuidance: Key contextual information. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The date of death of the person.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Person death date

concept.name: Alerts
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This section allows for the sharing of
alerts, which should be determined
locally. They might, for example,
include the fact that the person has a
dangerous dog.
It is important that alerts are managed
and removed when they are no longer
relevant – e.g. “the dangerous dog”
alert if the dog is no longer present.
The alerts displayed to users viewing the
core information may vary by use case and
user’s role.  <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Details of alerts.

concept.name: Alerts record entry
concept.description: This is an alerts record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items

concept.name: Alert
concept.description: Any significant information meriting a specific and highly visible warning to any user (e.g. metallic implant, potential dangerous pet).

concept.name: Person completing record
concept.description: Details of the person completing the record.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the person completing the record.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The organisational role of the person completing record.

concept.name: Grade
concept.description: The grade of the person completing the record.

concept.name: Specialty
concept.description: The main specialty of the person completing the record.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Activity treatment function code

concept.name: Organisation
concept.description: The organisation the person completing the record works for.

concept.name: Professional identifier
concept.description: Professional identifier for the person completing the record e.g. GMC number, HCPC number etc, or the personal identifier used by the local organisation.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Professional registration identifier

concept.name: Date completed
concept.description: The date and time the record was completed.

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the person completing the record. <br clear="none"/>
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - UK telephone number

concept.name: Legal information
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This section identifies where there is
legal or formal documentation relating
to the care of the person. This includes
Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA),
Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards
(DoLS), Mental Capacity Assessments
(MCAs) and Mental Health Act (MHA)
status.
The documentation may be available
centrally as part of shared care records
or held locally as part of the persons
social care records.
Copies of the legal documents should be
made available where possible as these
may have a direct bearing on treatment.  <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The legal information relating to the person.

concept.name: Mental capacity assessment
concept.implamentationGuidance:
Mental capacity needs to be assessed at
each decision point, for instance where
decisions around treatment, discharge,
support needs, living situation or other
factors need to be made. Hence there
should be provisions for more than one
mental capacity assessment to be shared. If
sharing the outcome of a mental capacity
assessment it is important to record to
which decision it relates.
The mental capacity assessment is based on
one of the following Acts, Mental Capacity Act 2005 (England and
Wales)
Adults with Incapacity Act 2000 (Scotland)
Mental Capacity Act 2016 (Northern Ireland) <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Details of the persons mental capacity assessment

concept.name: Date
concept.implamentationGuidance: Key contextual information <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The date when the mental capacity assessment was made.

concept.name: Location
concept.implamentationGuidance: Key contextual information <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The location where the mental capacity assessment was made.

concept.description: The coded value for location
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Organisation code

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Mental capacity assessment
concept.description: Whether an assessment of the mental capacity of the (adult) person has been undertaken, if so, what capacity the decision relates to and the outcome of the assessment. Also record best interests decision if person lacks capacity.

concept.name: Lasting power of attorney for personal welfare or court-appointed deputy (or equivalent)
concept.implamentationGuidance:
The name of the LPA should be recorded.
The authority of the LPA should be recorded
as SNOMED CT codes (see National
Information Standard (SCCI1580) and
associated text must be displayed. Where
available a copy of the documentation may
be appended to the record. The contact
details of the LPA should be recorded under
the personal contacts heading. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Details of the person's LPA record or equivalent

concept.name: Date
concept.description: The date the LPA was recorded

concept.name: Location
concept.description: The location where the LPA was given

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for location
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Organisation code

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Lasting power of attorney for personal welfare or court appointed deputy (or equivalent)
concept.description: Record of one or more people who have been given power (LPA) by the person when they had capacity to make decisions about their health and welfare should they lose capacity to make those decisions. To be valid, an LPA must have been registered with the Court of Protection. If life-sustaining treatment is being considered the LPA document must state specifically that the attorney has been given power to consent to or refuse life-sustaining treatment. Details of any person (deputy) appointed by the court to make decisions about the person’s health and welfare. A deputy does not have the power to refuse life-sustaining treatment.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for the LPA
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^999001951000000107 |Personal welfare lasting power of attorney findings simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.description: The location of the LPA information

concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary:- UK telephone number

concept.name: Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards or equivalent
concept.implamentationGuidance:
Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards (DoLs)
has been replaced by the Liberty Protection
Safeguards Scheme (LPS). Deprivations of
liberty are authorised in advance by the
legally responsible body. The Local authority
is responsible in cases except where the
location is an NHS hospital or where there
are Continuing Health Care arrangements.
The target date for implementation of LPS is
April 1 2022 (See link above).  <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Details of the person's Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards (DoLS) or equivalent

concept.name: Application date
concept.description: The date the application was made

concept.name: Application status
concept.description: The status of the DOLs application.

concept.name: Deprivation of liberty safeguards or equivalent
concept.description: Record of Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards (DoLS) or equivalent, including the reason for this.

concept.name: Start date of authorisation
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This data item entry (along with planned or
actual end date of authorisation, below)
ensures the end user can ascertain which
LPS schemes are currently active and
which are historical. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The date the DOLs was authorised.

concept.name: Planned or actual end date of authorisation
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This data item entry (along with start date of
authorisation, above) ensures the end user
can ascertain which LPS schemes are
currently active and which are historical. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The planned or actual end date of authorisation.

concept.name: Mental health act or equivalent status
concept.implamentationGuidance:
There can be more than one record of
‘Mental health act status’ (a record of a
decision to detain the person diagnosed
with a mental disorder under the Mental
Health Act or equivalent, recorded as free
text for this element). <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Details of the persons mental health act record

concept.name: Section start date
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This data item entry (along with section end
date below) ensures the end user can
ascertain which of a person’s Mental Health
Act or equivalent status entries are
contemporaneous and which are historical. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The date the person was detained.

concept.name: Section end date
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This data item entry (along with section start
date above) ensures the end user can
ascertain which of a person’s Mental Health
Act or equivalent status entries are
contemporaneous and which are historical. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The date the person was no longer detained.

concept.description: The location where the decision to detain the person was made under the mental health act.

concept.name: Safeguarding
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This section includes any concerns in
relation to safeguarding and is
applicable to children and adults. This
section includes whether a child is
looked after and indicates the
presence of a Child Protection Plan or
Unborn Child Protection Plan.
There may be situations where it is not
safe to share information in this
section with the person to whom it
relates, although the first choice
should be to share this information
with the person at risk or harm. so
local implementations may need to
apply filters in these cases.
Appropriate policies and technical
solutions need to be in place for these
situations.
Access must be controlled to this
information as per SCCI1609: Child
Protection - Information Sharing. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The safeguarding details of the person.

concept.name: Safeguarding concerns
concept.description: Details of safeguarding concerns

concept.name: Safeguarding concerns date
concept.implamentationGuidance:
Key contextual information. In the context of
local authority information this would be the
date the local authority was notified of the
concern. This data item entry (along with
safeguarding concerns end date, below)
ensures the end user can ascertain which of
a person’s safeguarding concern entries are
contemporaneous and which are historical. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The date the safeguarding concerns were identified.

concept.name: Safeguarding concerns end date
concept.implamentationGuidance:
Key contextual information. In this context,
this would be the date the safeguarding
concern was closed (irrespective of whether
an enquiry was triggered).
This data item entry (along with safeguarding
concerns start date, above) ensures the end
user can ascertain which of a person’s
safeguarding concern entries are
contemporaneous and which are historical.  <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The date safeguarding concerns ended.

concept.name: Location
concept.description: The location where the safeguarding concerns were identified.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value of location
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Organisation code

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Safeguarding concerns
concept.implamentationGuidance:
It is recognised that local authorities may
not record the details of safeguarding
concerns as a matter of policy. In such
scenarios, health organisations enquiring
about a safeguarding flag may be directed to the local Multi-Agency Safeguarding Hub
(MASH) team. <br clear="none"/>

concept.name: Local authority
concept.implamentationGuidance: Key contextual information. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The details of the Local Authority that is responsible for providing care and support to the person.

concept.name: Organisation code
concept.description: The ODS (Organisation Data Service) code of the local authority that is responsible for providing care and support to the person.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Organisation data service

concept.name: Local authority name
concept.description: The name of the local authority that is responsible for providing care and support to the person.

concept.name: Social services team
concept.description: The name of the local authority social services team or department that is responsible for undertaking the care and support assessment for the person.

concept.name: Local authority contact name
concept.description: The name of the person at the local authority who is responsible for liaising with the hospital in relation to the person’s discharge.

concept.name: Local authority contact details
concept.description: The contact details of the person at the local authority who is responsible for liaising with the hospital in relation to the person’s discharge.

concept.name: Professional contacts
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This section includes current and
historic details of health and care
professionals, teams or organisations
involved in the care of the person and
held in local authority records. Third
sector organisations can be included. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The details of the person’s professional contacts.

concept.name: Professional contacts record entry
concept.description: This is a professional contacts record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the professional with responsibility for the care of the person.

concept.name: Role
concept.implamentationGuidance:
NB: ‘Social worker’ is a protected title. Use
free text for workers in adult social care who
are not social workers. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The role the professional has in relation to the person e.g. GP, physiotherapist, community nurse, social worker, key worker, care home manager, care coordinator, LA hospital liaison person, care home contact, hospital clinician, Independent Mental Capacity Advocate (IMCA) etc

concept.name: Key worker
concept.description: A flag that identifies the personal contact is the key worker assigned to the person.

concept.name: Speciality
concept.description: The specialty of the professional e.g. physiotherapy, oncology, mental health etc
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Activity treatment function code

concept.name: Team
concept.description: The name of the team.

concept.name: Organisation
concept.description: The name of the organisation.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for location
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Organisation data service

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the professional (e.g. telephone number, email address etc.).

concept.name: Start date
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This data item entry (along with end date
below) ensures the end user can ascertain
which professional relationships are
contemporaneous and which are historical. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The start date of the professional relationship with the person.

concept.name: End date
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This data item entry (along with start date
above) ensures the end user can ascertain
which professional relationships are
contemporaneous and which are historical. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The end date of the professional relationship with the person.

concept.name: Personal contacts
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This section includes the personal contacts
(e.g. family, friends, relatives etc.).
Comments should be used to share
information such as if a particular contact
should be called in an emergency etc.  <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The details of the individual's personal contacts.

concept.name: Personal contacts record entry
concept.description: This is personal contacts record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the personal contact.

concept.name: Relationship
concept.description: The relationship the personal contact has to the person, e.g. father, grandmother, family friend etc.
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set : - Related person

concept.name: Relationship type
concept.implamentationGuidance:
NB: The term ‘next of kin’ has no legal basis.
See here for further information. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Additional roles the person performs on behalf of the other (e.g. Carer, Next of Kin, Emergency Contact, Dependent, etc.)

concept.name: Parental Responsibility
concept.description: Flag to indicate whether the personal contact has parental responsibility

concept.name: Household member
concept.description: Status identifying whether the personal contact is a member of the same household

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the personal contact (e.g. telephone number, email address etc.)

concept.name: NHS Number
concept.description: The NHS number of the personal contact
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary:- NHS NUMBER

concept.name: Comments
concept.description: Notes on the significance of the personal contact to the person.

concept.name: Referral details
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This section includes a record of the current
referrals made by the local authority but may
also include details of other referrals that a
local authority wishes to share.
This section includes a record of
current and historic referrals. Referral
details includes the service a person is
being referred from. A service may not
always be coded. If the service is
known, and a code is available, it
should be included otherwise the
service should be described in free
text <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The details of the referral.

concept.name: Referral details record entry
concept.description: This is the referral details record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Date
concept.description: The date of referral

concept.name: Referrer details
concept.description:
The details of the referrer. <br clear="none"/> 
                         <br clear="none"/> This could be the person, GP surgery, department, specialty, sub-specialty, educational institution, mental health team etc.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the referrer.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: Role of the referrer.

concept.name: Grade
concept.description: The grade of the referrer.

concept.name: Team
concept.description: The team or department of the referrer.

concept.name: Specialty
concept.description: The specialty of the referrer.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary - Activity treatment function code

concept.name: Service
concept.description: The service of the referrer.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for service
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - 1127531000000102 |Services simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Organisation
concept.description: The organisation of the referrer.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for organisation code
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Organisation data service

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: The contact details of the referrer.

concept.name: Referral type
concept.description: An indication of the type of referral (e.g. 'Hospital Discharge Notification to Social Care', 'GP Referral', etc.)

concept.name: Reason for referral
concept.implamentationGuidance:
In a social care context other reasons for
referral may include, for assessment of a
person with dementia, accommodation
needs, social care needs assessment etc. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The reason for the referral, e.g. diagnosis, treatment, transfer of care due to relocation, investigation, second opinion, management of the patient (e.g. palliative care), or carer's concerns.

concept.name: Referral to
concept.description:
Details of where the referral is to be sent. <br clear="none"/> 
                         <br clear="none"/> If not an individual, this could be a service, e.g. GP surgery, department, specialty, subspecialty, educational institution, mental health etc.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: Name of person the referral is to be sent to.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: Role of person where the referral is to be sent to.

concept.name: Grade
concept.description: The grade of the person where the referral is sent to.

concept.name: Team
concept.description: The team or department of the person where the referral is being sent to

concept.name: Specialty
concept.description: The specialty the referral is being sent to e.g. physiotherapy, oncology, mental health etc
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary - Activity treatment function code

concept.name: Service
concept.description: The service of where the referral is sent to.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for service
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - 1127531000000102 |Services simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Organisation
concept.description: The organisation of where the referral is to be sent.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for organisation
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Organisation data service

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: The contact details of where the referral is to be sent.

concept.name: Services and care
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This section is a record of the services being
provided (or that have previously been
provided) by the local authority or arranged
by the local authority and provided by a care
agency or other service provider. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The services and care provided for the person.

concept.name: Services and care record entry
concept.description: This is a services and care record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Social care package name
concept.description: Name of specific type of package being provided (e.g. Reablement, Home Based Care XYZ, etc)

concept.name: Social care package type
concept.description: Higher level categorisation of package type, e.g. Adults Home Support

concept.name: Service start date
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This data item entry (along with service end
date) ensures the end user can ascertain
which services are contemporaneous and
which are historical. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The date service started to be provided.

concept.name: Service end date
concept.implamentationGuidance:
This data item entry (along with service start
date) ensures the end user can ascertain
which services are contemporaneous and
which are historical. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The date the service is planned to be ended or the actual end date.

concept.name: Local authority
concept.implamentationGuidance:
If a care agency or other professional or
organisation is providing the care package.
The professional or organisation providing
the service, along with contact details
should be made available where possible
(in the ‘Performing professional’ subsection
of Services and care – see PRSB Core
Information Standard). <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The name of the local authority providing the care package.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for local authority
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Organisation data service

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Care funding source
concept.description: A reference to the funding source and any conditions or limitations associated.

concept.name: Person completing record
concept.description: Details of the person completing the record.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the person completing the record.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The organisational role of the person completing record.

concept.name: Grade
concept.description: The grade of the person completing the record.

concept.name: Specialty
concept.description: The main specialty of the person completing the record.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Activity treatment function code

concept.name: Organisation
concept.description: The organisation the person completing the record works for.

concept.name: Professional identifier
concept.description: Professional identifier for the person completing the record e.g. GMC number, HCPC number etc, or the personal identifier used by the local organisation.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Professional registration identifier

concept.name: Date completed
concept.description: The date and time the record was completed.

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the person completing the record. <br clear="none"/>
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - UK telephone number

concept.name: Primary support reason
concept.implamentationGuidance:
Data entry should include one of the six
primary support reason classifications and/or
subclassifications, described in the
Equalities and Classifications Framework
(EQ-CL). In addition, examples may be
given. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The primary support reason for social care.

concept.name: Primary support reason record entry
concept.description: This is a primary support reason record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Primary support reason
concept.description: The Primary Support Reason used to classify a person for National Reporting on Short and Long Term Services (SALT) e.g. Learning disability support, mental health support, physical support

concept.name: Active
concept.implamentationGuidance:
As local authorities may record multiple
primary support reasons over time, but only
one is active (reason for funding). This flag is
necessary to easily distinguish the current
support reason. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Flag to indicate whether the primary support reason is currently active

concept.name: Start date
concept.implamentationGuidance:
Key contextual information.
This data item entry provides the end user
with historical context relating to the primary
support reason. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The date a primary support reason was authorised as active.

concept.name: End date
concept.implamentationGuidance:
Key contextual information.
This data item entry provides the end user
with historical context relating to the primary
support reason. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The end date of authorisation.

concept.name: Assessments
concept.description: Details of the person's assessments

concept.name: Assessments record entry
concept.description: This is the assessments record entry. There may be 0 to many record entry/entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Date
concept.description: The date the assessment was done.

concept.name: Location
concept.description: The location where the assessment was done.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for location
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Organisation data service

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Assessment type
concept.description: The type of the assessment e.g. social care needs assessment.

concept.name: Assessment summary
concept.description: The summary of the assessment

concept.name: Structured assessment
concept.description: Details of the structured assessment.

concept.name: Structured assessment name
concept.description: Structured assessment name e.g. New York Heart Failure, Glasgow Coma scale, Activities of Daily Living (ADL) etc.

concept.name: Assessment score
concept.description: The structured assessment score.

concept.name: Assessment value
concept.description: The structured assessment value.

concept.name: Global score
concept.description: The total global score from the assessment.

concept.name: Subscale score
concept.description: The subscale score of the structured assessment.

concept.name: Subscale value
concept.description: The subscale value of the structured assessment.

concept.name: Performing professional
concept.description: The professional who did the assessment.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the professional.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The role the professional has in relation to the person e.g. GP, physiotherapist, community nurse, social worker etc
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set :- SDSjobroletype

concept.name: Grade
concept.description: The grade of the professional.

concept.name: Speciality
concept.description: The specialty of the professional e.g. physiotherapy, oncology, mental health etc
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary - Activity treatment function code

concept.name: Professional identifier
concept.description: Professional identifier for the professional e.g. GMC number, HCPC number etc or the personal identifier used by the local organisation.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Professional registration identifier

concept.name: Organisation
concept.description: The name of the organisation the professional works for.

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the professional
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary - UK phone number

concept.name: Person completing record
concept.description: Details of the person completing the record.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the person completing the record.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The organisational role of the person completing record.

concept.name: Grade
concept.description: The grade of the person completing the record.

concept.name: Specialty
concept.description: The main specialty of the person completing the record.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Activity treatment function code

concept.name: Organisation
concept.description: The organisation the person completing the record works for.

concept.name: Professional identifier
concept.description: Professional identifier for the person completing the record e.g. GMC number, HCPC number etc, or the personal identifier used by the local organisation.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Professional registration identifier

concept.name: Date completed
concept.description: The date and time the record was completed.

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the person completing the record. <br clear="none"/>
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - UK telephone number

concept.name: Comment
concept.description: Supporting text may be given regarding the assessment.

concept.name: Equipment and adaptations
concept.implamentationGuidance:
It is recognised that detailed data about the
type of equipment provided by the local
authority to the patient are generally not
recorded in a structured way in social care.
Details relating to equipment, such as
review or maintenance requirements may
be obtainable from assisted living services
the contact details of which, can be stored
in local or shared care records under
‘Comment’. Major and/or minor adaptations
should also be entered in this section. Note
that some equipment may be considered to
be part of medical devices in the CIS – See
Core Information Standard Implementation
Guidance (update in progress). <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Details of equipment/asset (or modifications) that the Local Authority has provided to the patient.

concept.name: Equipment record entry
concept.description: This is a equipment record entry. There may be 1 to many record entries under a section.

concept.name: Equipment name
concept.description: The name of the equipment (e.g. 'Keysafe', 'Handrail' 'Lifeline Alarm', etc.)

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for equipment name

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Date
concept.description: <br clear="none"/> The date the equipment was issued.

concept.name: Comment
concept.implamentationGuidance:
For smaller equipment issued by the local
authority details that could be recorded
under this element as free text include
ordering, implementation date, six weeks
review and annual review etc. <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Any further details about the equipment, e.g. position of handrail(s) within the person's home
